timeline.bodyText:
What about something like this?
By default, InfluxDB treats all values as floats. We need to add 'i' suffix to interpret the value as an integer.
timeline.author: kamilwu

timeline.bodyText: If you want to make it even more secure and resilient, you can check what's the value of Content-Type header. For JSON, it must be application/json. Some HTTP libraries has convenient methods for doing that.
timeline.author: kamilwu

replies.bodyText:
Yes, that's why I check encoding type to be prepared for case when influx would stop sending us JSON (and start something else)
final Charset encoding =
        encodingHeader == null
            ? StandardCharsets.UTF_8
            : Charsets.toCharset(encodingHeader.getValue());
replies.author: pawelpasterz

replies.bodyText: Isn't it possible that you get UTF-8-encoded data, but not necessarily JSON?

We should do the same for numResults. Now the schema that is being created is:
